snippet: The Obama administration said Friday that it would charge insurance companies for selling health insurance to millions of Americans in new online markets run by the federal government.
abstract: Obama administration says that it will charge insurance companies for privilege of selling health insurance to millions of Americans in new online markets run by the federal government; in separate action, federal officials announce consumers will soon have access to nationwide health plans similar to those available to federal employees.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration said Friday that it would charge insurance companies for selling health insurance to millions of Americans in new online markets run by the federal government.

headline.seo: Health Insurers Will Be Charged to Use New Exchanges
headline.main: Health Insurers Will Be Charged to Use New Exchanges
headline.print_headline: For Insurers, Exchanges Can Be Used For a Fee

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
